results.title: The Baby Boomers' Picture Show
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, ABC-TV (Australia) and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Inspired by the book “Baby Boomers” by Helen Townsend, “The Baby Boomers’ Picture Show” re-creates the sensations, the thrills and the horrors of growing up in Australia in the 1950’s and 1960’s.

results.title: The Aymara: a case study in social stratification
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Faces of culture”.
For centuries the social structure of Bolivia consisted of three classes, a white oligarchy, the Spanish speaking mestizo middle class and an Indian peasantry. The 1952 revolution did much to change this, but the basic structure still exists, particularly in rural backwaters such as are portrayed in this video. In Ayata and Vitocoto the class system is still horrifically alive and well, as the despised peasantry labour for the mestizo landowners and priests for little or no pay and no hope of improvement due to inequalities in educational opportunities and health care. Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Ron Tanner, Peter Griffiths, Lloyds Bank and Millbank Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Starting your own business”.
This is the second film in the series, Starting Your Own Business. The film continues the story of the three people who are self-employed, and it traces the first year in business for each of the characters. Again the problems and pitfalls involved in going it alone are identified and the audience can see the reasons why two of the businesses fail.

results.title: The Awaited Messiah
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
This is the beginning of the story of the life of Jesus Christ, from the betrothal of Mary and Joseph; the Angel visits Mary; the wedding of Mary and Joseph and the unrest of young zealots.

results.title: The Automated mariner
results.creator_credit: Roger Lupton, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how radar, sonar, and echosound are used to catch the variety of edible sealife found around the coast of Tasmania. Narrated by Frank Bansel, music performed by the Tasmanian Symphony Orchestra conducted by Pinchas Steinberg.

results.title: The Austrian Tyrol
results.brief_description: Famed for its natural beauty and alpine grandeur, the Austrian Tyrol has excellent mountain roads for enjoyable walks or mountain climbing. The film shows some of the villages including the 700 years old city of Innsbruck nestling below the vast mountains.

results.title: The Australian impressionists 1888-1896
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
A look at paintings by Australian impressionists - A Holiday at Mentone: Charles Conder (1888). The Breakaway: Tom Roberts (1890-91). Fire’s On, Lapstone Tunnel: Arthur Streeton (1891). Moonrise, Templestowe: David Davies (1894). On the Wallaby Track: Frederick McCubbin (1896).
